intro: Haplopappus formosus, commonly known as the silverleaf groundsel, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its silver-gray foliage and small yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, such as rocky soils and open woodlands. Its leaves are narrow and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss in dry conditions. The plant produces small, wind-dispersed seeds that contribute to its spread in suitable habitats.
